qas.question: What was Samoa's major production product before the Germans arrived?
What product significantly dropped in price at the end of World War I?
What did Samoa start growing more of to make up for the lost value of rubber?
Which country's government wanted Samoa to grow bananas for them?
Besides Melanesia, which country sent many workers for the cocoa and rubber plantations in Samoa?
What did China produce before Melanesian colonization?
What new industries were produced by China in Somoa?

plausible_answers.text: the New Zealand government encouraged the production of bananas

qas.question: What happened when the price of cocoa beans fell?
What is there a large market for in Melanesia?
What groups were developing new industries and plantations in Melanesia?

context: In the period before German colonisation, Samoa produced <b5_0>mostly <a0_0>copra<b5_0/><a0_0/>. <b9_0>German merchants and settlers<b9_0/> were active in introducing large scale plantation operations and developing new industries, notably <b6_0>cocoa bean and rubber<b6_0/>, relying on imported labourers from <a4_0>China<a4_0/> and Melanesia. When the value of <a1_0>natural rubber<a1_0/> fell drastically, about the end of the Great War (World War I), <b7_0>the <a3_0>New Zealand<a3_0/> government encouraged the production of <a2_0><b8_0>bananas<b8_0/><b7_0/><a2_0/>, for which there is a large market in New Zealand.[citation needed]
